data.title: Tooltip for the Inspector's history button
data.body: Closes #2673

data.title: Automatic Y-sorting for sprites
data.body:
That's necessary when your sprites are of 2 tiles height, but only the bottom tile has collision. The sprites with lower Y should be drawn first.
Something like this:
![phantasystar4-3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9574367/10716674/5451e5a4-7b0e-11e5-878b-77b6d533a13a.jpg)

data.title: Made some small updates to classes.xml
data.body:
I wanted to add a some of my notes on matrix32, array, color, and sprite/set_modulate()

I goofed on the tilemap_cpp updates and submitted those as an independent pull request but I reverted them so there's a lot of commits here.  So this should only update classes.xml

data.title: No info text on button
data.body:
Since there is no description, I do not know what button this is. 
When you hover over this icon there is no description showing.
![Icon](http://i.imgur.com/2MVMs2k.png) 
It is found inside the Inspector on the upper right corner within it.

data.title: Fix for world_to_map() with negative coords.  Fixes issue #2665
data.body: int() of negative numbers rounds up. Needed to add a condition to account for negative values. Thanks to Romulox_x for providing this solution.

data.title: raspberry pi support
data.body:
I know the Raspberry Pi and Raspberry Pi 2 are not officially supported, and that there is a working fork out there, but it has got some issues which make it close to worthless. However, I think that some of those problems might be easy to address. 

For example, one of the big issues is that the mouse cursor is always under the interface objects, but I think that if one can make the mouse cursor be drawn by Godot's GUI in a similar way as the other interface objects, that would be enough for solving the problem. I guess that would be pretty easy to implement. 

I don't know anything C++, only C (and also some OO languages), otherwise I could do that myself. But then, if someone can at least give me directions like where to begin to look at the source files to use the stuff to do this, I'd be glad, and very willing to try.

data.title: UI access to 2D pivot editing feature
data.body: I would suggest placing it in Menu.  I know that it is poor place for because it was designed to be used from shortcut, but placing it in menu will make it visible for users so they will know that it exists and "what shortcut it was again"?

data.title: Polygon 2D - editing polygon point resets UVs
data.body: Currently if you create your UVs for Polygon2D and you decide that you need extra point in that polygon, adding it or removing resets WHOLE UV and you have to start all over again ;)

data.title: Grid Map node editing broken when node is rotated
data.body:
How to reproduce:
Open 3D platformer demo stage.xml scene.
Rotate Grid Map node.
Try to paint-edit it.

What happens: although pre-existing elements are deleted correctly new onea are added in wrong place, looks like they are added based on global not local space.

data.title: Camera smoothing causes sprites to flicker
data.body:
When using 2d pixel snap with a camera that has smoothing enabled, sprites flicker (move, say, left-right ~1 pix several times) just before the camera settles. 

The position of spires is probably a non-integer.

**Edit:** Problem persists without pixel snap.

data.title: [Error] Compiling on Windows produces TypeError
data.body:
While I won't disregard the possibility of user error on my part; I believe there _might_ be an issue with the latest godot build.

Following the guide in the wiki ([here](https://github.com/okamstudio/godot/wiki/compiling_windows)), I have installed python 2.7 and latest version of scones. 

I have cloned the repository and attempted to compile using scons. I get an error;
([screenshot here](http://i.imgur.com/nzq1TlY.png))
#### Administrator: Developer Command Prompt for VS2015:

**C:\godot>scons platform=windows
scons: Reading SConscript files ...
TypeError: cannot concatenate 'str' and 'NoneType' objects:
  File "C:\godot\SConstruct", line 230:
    detect.configure(env)
  File "./platform/windows\detect.py", line 221:
    env.Append(CCFLAGS=['/I'+os.getenv("WindowsSdkDir")+"/Include"])**

Is this a common problem? I have tried searching for it, but could not find a solution. 
Could it possibly be a version problem with VS? I am using Visual Studio Community 2015.

data.title: Tilemap world_to_map() && half_offset && coords < 0 does not work as expected
data.body:
When half offset is set to offset x, the offset behaves unexpectedly for  y<0.  Likewise, when half offset is set to offset y, the offset behaves unexpectedly for x<0.  world_to_map() will return the wrong coordinates half of the time. This can be tested in the editor.

In the first attached screenshot, the mouse cursor is at the black arrow where the blue lines intersect, but the highlighted tile is to the right.  In the second attached screenshot, the mouse cursor moves down along the blue line and the highlighted tile now is to the left.  Half offset is set to Offset X and the mouse is in the y<0 region.

The expected behavior is that the tile the mouse cursor is inside is to be highlighted.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13324089/10695646/c4337b50-7972-11e5-8711-1823a4e3bb23.png)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13324089/10695830/ce182cb4-7973-11e5-9b3a-bbcd13feeae8.png)

data.title: Added CADisplayLink setting for iOS
data.body: Added setting for CADisplayLink on iOS, so you no longer need to recompile to change it.

data.title: Ask confirmation if closing scene was modified (using close [x] tab)
data.body:
- SWITCHED THE SCENE TAB CLOSE BUTTON DISPLAY POLICY TO "SHOW_ACTIVE_ONLY" !
- Also added a missing break;  statement

data.title: Added low_memory_2d_mode
data.body: Added low_memory_2d_mode, to indicate when 3D post processing buffers and viewport depth buffers should not be allocated

data.title: [Fixed] 'Replace a node by another node type' not working after loading the scene
data.body:
Repo steps:

Create new scene.
Add root node and child node.
Save scene.
Close scene.
Open scene.
Nodes in scene can't be replaced by another node type.

Workaround:
Rename node, replace, return to old name.

data.title: Play button should Restart Project if it's already running
data.body:
Why do I have to press "Stop the Scene" first to restart the project?

"Play the Project " -> "Stop the Scene" -> "Play the Project "

Why not 

"Play the Project " -> "Play the Project(restart if running) "

I always forget to close the game so I change something and press Play but it doesn't work I have to "Stop the Scene" -> "Play the Project " ....

So annoying :D are there any side effect to add this feature?

OS:ubuntu

After disconnecting the screen the project is always starting.

data.title: White line around tiles
data.body:
Hi!
Why I have white lines around tiles in this example. I solved this problem in BGE by setting to alpha clip, but I did not see any option in godot.
Here is example file:

http://www.mediafire.com/download/bfoh77ov997472l/white_lines_around_tiles.tar.gz

data.title: Fix icons (default location and in demos)
data.body:
I was getting the following error in the project manager:

```
ERROR OPENING FILE: icon.png
```

By default, when creating a new project, the code was using `icon.png` instead of `res://icon.png` for the icon in the `engine.cfg` file.  This fixes that as well as adjusts the demos to either use that location if the demo has an icon or removes the icon if it doesn't have one.

data.title: Debug console crash when getting autoloaded node at the top of the file
data.body:
In my project that was made in 1.1 I was sometimes fetching autoloads to the member  reference variable at the declaration line (basically almost at the top of the file, not in any function). This in Godot 2.0 Alpha (b59c86f6f953ce6957bccbcc1ec6f3ce4c55572d) is causing crash of debug console, so in the end when game crashes there is no indicator why. 
I'm unable to reproduce this in every project (on simple ones it works fine for me), but I modified platformer 3d demo in the way it's behaving like this. (In the demo there is an Autoload that causes crash because of calling funcion on null, after couple seconds from running it).

Steps:
1. Download sample project
2. Load editor with the project
3. Run it instantly.
4. Project will crash in a couple seconds and there will be no indication on why (hopefully)

Anyway here is sample project:
https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/168251/godot/some/issues/platformerDebugConsoleCrash.7z

Here is one minute video from my experimentation, first part with debug console crash, second part with fix: https://youtu.be/F4t756bWS9I

Further observations:
In other project, when I was trying to pause game with breakpoint and debug (which is possible for some time before console crash) I was able to see an error that there is no such node like "/root/global" (at the time when given node should be fetchable)
Also it seems that this bug is **not easy to reproduce** and might be related to performance somehow. It's harder for me to reproduce with release_debug compilation flags... (but still possible). 
Because of that I think this bug should not be labeled as 2.0 milestone, until more people will have it.

data.title: Using Navigation2D Node with a tilemap print "LINK" and "UNLINK"
data.body:
It seems if you use a navigation2D with a tilemap as children, and this tilemap use tile with navigationmeshinstance in it, engine print "LINK" and "UNLINK" for each tile.

Error can't be reproduced with this example https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=S-zEA_Ce1mk

Checking in repository, i can't get why happening in 2D because in:
scene/2d/navigation2d.cpp (print_line have comments)
scene/3d/navigation.cpp (print_line haven't)

data.title: < replaced by > (and vice versa) when saving a scene in xml or xscn format
data.body:
You can reproduce the bug by creating a new scene with only a label in it, and set the text to something containing '>' or '<'. Save it to xml or xscn and launch the scene.

Maybe something to do with https://github.com/okamstudio/godot/pull/2512

It's realy important to be able to save in these formats for versioning, so as a workaround you can set texts in scripts and save them as .gd resources (don't use builtin scripts)
